shelf_life.notes: Sealed tab prevents air activation. Once tab removed, battery must be used within days

variants.rechargeable_options: Silver-zinc and lithium-ion rechargeable versions available

safety_notes: Keep away from children - choking hazard
Do not remove tab until ready to use
Air-activated chemistry - seal air holes to extend life
Replace when hearing aid beeps or sounds distorted
usage_notes: Wait 1-2 minutes after removing tab before inserting
Allows air to fully activate the battery
Typical lifespan: 7-10 days depending on usage
Popular size for many hearing aid models
notes: Mid-size hearing aid battery. Zinc-air chemistry provides stable voltage and high energy density. Air-activated system requires removal of sealing tab. Color-coded brown for easy identification. Good balance of size and capacity.

sources.name: Battery Equivalents - Hearing Aid Batteries Guide
